description: Ocean Waves is high school love story set in Kochi, Japan. Morisaki Taku and Matsuno Yutaka are best friends when a girl from Tokyo named Muto Rikako transfers to their school. Excluding herself from group activities, she’s eventually labeled a snob. Matsuno has a crush on Rikako, so it’s no surprise that he gets a little jealous when Morisaki and Rikako start spending more time together. The rumors around school get worse, but Morisaki still insists there is nothing between him and Rikako.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Coastal
tags.description: Story prominently takes place near the beach or around a coastal area/town. Setting is near the ocean.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Historical
tags.description: Partly or completely set during a real period of world history.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: School Club
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a school club scene.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/fusatora2828) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/mangetsuhakase)

While attending Waseda University, Mochizuki became interested in animation and he joined the Waseda University Animation Association. In 1981, he began working for Ajia-do Animation Works. Mochizuki made his debut one year later when he acted as production director of the 1982 series Tokimeki Tonight. He went on to direct several of the magical girl series, including Magical Angel Creamy Mami. In 1986, he moved up to chief director with Hikari no Densetsu.

Mochizuki became known from the early 1990s as director of Ranma ½, Kimagure Orange Road and the Studio Ghibli TV movie Ocean Waves, he is also known for having directed Twin Spica, Zettai Shounen, the acclaimed World Masterpiece Theater series Porphy no Nagai Tabi. More recently he directed the noitaminA series House of Five Leaves in 2010 and Battery in 2016.

He currently divides his time between directing, writing scripts and acting as a series coordinator for various shows.

Married to [Masako Gotou](https://anilist.co/staff/153654/).

[Website (WMG)](https://wmg.jp/shimamotosumi/) | [Wiki (JP)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%B3%B6%E6%9C%AC%E9%A0%88%E7%BE%8E)

A Japanese actress, voice actress and narrator of film, anime and video games. She is currently independent of any talent management company.

After graduating from the Toho Gakuen College of Drama and Music, she joined Gekidan Seinenza, a theatrical acting troupe. Her best-known voice roles include [Nausicaä](https://anilist.co/character/539/) in [Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind](https://anilist.co/anime/572/), and [Kyouko Otonashi](https://anilist.co/character/4745/) in [Maison Ikkoku](https://anilist.co/anime/1453/).

She won the role of Nausicaä as she had played [Clarisse](https://anilist.co/character/11236/) in [The Castle of Cagliostro](https://anilist.co/anime/1430/) and impressed Hayao Miyazaki.

She is married to Daisuke Koshikawa, one of the founders of the comedy troupe Chibikko Gang. Their first child, [Shiori Koshikawa](https://anilist.co/staff/185752/Koshikawa-Shiori), has also done voice acting.

(Source: Wikipedia)

Toshio Suzuki  is a film producer of anime and a long-time colleague of [Hayao Miyazaki](https://anilist.co/staff/96870/), as well as the former president of [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/). Suzuki is renowned as one of Japan's most successful producers after the enormous national box office success of many Ghibli films.

He was instrumental in getting the [Nausicaä](https://anilist.co/anime/572/) anime made and helped establish Studio Ghibli shortly after the film's release. Miyazaki has stated, "If it were not for Mr. Suzuki, there wouldn't have been Studio Ghibli." Ghibli co-founder [Isao Takahata](https://anilist.co/staff/100579/), has acknowledged the pivotal role of Suzuki in bringing the Nausicaä manga series into the world and used nearly identical words as Miyazaki to acknowledge Suzuki’s essential role in the creation of Studio Ghibli. Takahata also credits Suzuki for his steadfast support of Miyazaki and has cited Suzuki’s responsibility for making his friendship with Miyazaki endure.

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.facebook.com%2Fshigeru.nagata)

Shigeru Nagata (永田茂) is a Japanese composer. He wrote the scores for [Here is Greenwood](https://anilist.co/anime/1804/Here-is-Greenwood/) and The [Ocean Waves (海がきこえる)](https://anilist.co/anime/743/Ocean-Waves/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/坂本洋子)

_Note: Not to be confused with the painter [Youko Sakamoto](https://anilist.co/staff/219299/)._
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/丹羽圭子)

[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.facebook.com%2Fshigeru.nagata)

Shigeru Nagata (永田茂) is a Japanese composer. He wrote the scores for [Here is Greenwood](https://anilist.co/anime/1804/Here-is-Greenwood/) and The [Ocean Waves (海がきこえる)](https://anilist.co/anime/743/Ocean-Waves/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/渡部猛)

**Non-anime roles:**
- Inazuma Ginga - Taiyo Sentai Sun Vulcan (TV Series)
- Baku Mozoo - Dai Sentai Goggle-V (TV Series)
- Teiou Aton - Kagaku Sentai Dynaman (TV Series)

[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.facebook.com%2Fshigeru.nagata)

Shigeru Nagata (永田茂) is a Japanese composer. He wrote the scores for [Here is Greenwood](https://anilist.co/anime/1804/Here-is-Greenwood/) and The [Ocean Waves (海がきこえる)](https://anilist.co/anime/743/Ocean-Waves/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/尾形英夫) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hideo_Ogata)

Hideo Ogata was a planner, producer and the founding editor of Animage magazine.

He served as the editor on [Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind](https://anilist.co/manga/30651/), an influential manga series created by [Hayao Miyazaki](https://anilist.co/staff/96870/), which serialized on Animage from 1982 to 1994. He was also one of the planners of the series' [film adaptation](https://anilist.co/anime/572/). In 1985, he was involved in the establishment of [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/) and contributed to its development by producing many of their films throughout the years. Some of his producer works outside of Ghibli movies include [The Legend of the Galactic Heroes](https://anilist.co/anime/820/) and [Nightsong of Splendor](https://anilist.co/anime/4485/).

Ogata passed away from stomach cancer on January 25, 2007. The eulogy at his funeral was read by Miyazaki.

(Source: Wikipedia)
Atsuko Ootani is an animator.
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/河口俊夫)
Freelancer who mostly works on [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/) films.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/747930872179875840)

A pioneer in the field of realist animation, and then digital processing.

Debuted uncredited as an in-betweneer on [Zeta Gundam](https://anilist.co/anime/85/). He made his initial splash in [Gundam 0080: War in the Pocket](https://anilist.co/anime/82/), and continued to develop his approach to animation which he calls "full limited," which eliminated the pose-to-pose feel of conventional keyframe animation. His characteristic animation can be seen in [Ghost in the Shell](https://anilist.co/anime/43/) and [End of Evangelion](https://anilist.co/anime/32/).

In [Blood: The Last Vampire](https://anilist.co/anime/405/), Iso experimented with digital processing of his hand-drawn fire effects, elevating it to uncanny realism. Iso then got his first taste of directing in [RahXephon](https://anilist.co/anime/165/) episode 15, which he largely animated and also digitally processed himself.

His animation sensibilities, process innovations, experience in multiple levels of anime production, and interest in technology culminated in the 2007 sci-fi series, [Dennou Coil](https://anilist.co/anime/2164/), his veritable brainchild. During its production, there was a rumored falling-out with key staff. For the next several years, Iso would quietly animate under the pseudonym Mikio Odagawa.

Took part as a key animator on Quentin Tarantino's "Kill Bill: Vol. 1" in 2003.

In 2018, he announced his retirement as an animator to focus exclusively on directing.
Originating from [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/). Freelance since 2003.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/altamontagna170)
Originating from [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/奥田誠治_(映画プロデューサー%29)

Seiji Okuda is a producer working for Nippon Television Network.

_Note: Not to be confused with the director and animator [Seiji Okuda](https://anilist.co/staff/112847/)._

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/近藤勝也)

Famous for his character designs on numerous of [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/)'s films, which are considered the epitome of the Ghibli style.

After graduating from high school, he began working for [Osamu Dezaki](https://anilist.co/staff/100393/) and [Akio Sugino](https://anilist.co/staff/103064/) at their Studio Annapuru. Under the direction of [Shinji Ootsuka](https://anilist.co/staff/124192/), Kondou worked as a key animator of the TV anime series Cat's Eye. He then worked as a free agent on such shows as [The Mighty Orbots](https://anilist.co/anime/8130/), Rainbow Brite and Disney's Adventures of the Gummi Bears. His first work with Studio Ghibli was as a key animator on [Castle in the Sky](https://anilist.co/anime/513/). After working on the Gainax film [The Wings of Honneamise](https://anilist.co/anime/1034/) and multiple OVAs around late '80s, Kondou began to be known for the high quality of his work.

He has also collaborated collaborated with Kenichi Sakemi on a manga retelling of the Joan of Arc story, as well as doing the character designs for the Jade Cocoon video game series.

(Source: Wikipedia)
Nobuhiro Shibata is a sound engineer.
